programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: The team is in New Jersey to build a tree-cabin for an outdoor-loving couple, featuring a screened-in porch, a floating barbecue deck and a hanging bed.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio brings his eye for design to the Sanders family, who need some major help to take back the house from their bunnies, ferrets, cats and dogs.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator McHugh tries to save a dog that has strayed onto a motorway, then helps a Chihuahua with a spinal injury.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator AJ Meadows gets called in when a dog gives birth to pups in an alley and they are struggling to survive. A complaint turns into a criminal investigation when a dog is found dead, and medical tech Tamie pleads for the life of an injured bird.

programme.title: Great White Appetite
programme.desc: Remarkably, scientists have no accurate data on the great whites population, mating or even feeding behaviour. Can new information shed light on these mysterious hunters?

programme.title: I Was Prey
programme.desc: What happens when predator becomes prey? These are the harrowing stories of individuals who have been viciously attacked by wild animals and lived to tell the tale.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: George and Beth are prisoners in their own home due to their ferocious kitty, Reese. Reese is a cat version of Jack the Ripper and Beth is one of his favourite targets.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Bindi and the zoo welcome two baby echidnas, but health concerns become a major threat for one puggles survival. Plus, a jabiru goes missing!

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers attempt to train Jackson, a golden eagle, for the educational programmes. Plus, the team shares the characteristics of a pack of African wild dogs.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: Nandi, the aquariums smallest manta ray, is due her annual check up and some young ruddy ducks arrive at the aquarium and are introduced to their new habitat.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff and Petra train new vets at a wildlife sanctuary in Mexico. While there, they spay an endangered jaguar, and help an injured osprey.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The ATM team race to complete a tank for a Las Vegas amusement park, the Mini Gran Prix. They design a 20 ft long tank featuring the lost City of Atlantis.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: An x-ray provides some surprising and crucial evidence in an investigation into a case of three starving dogs. Investigator AJ Meadows confronts the owner with the truth about what her animals had been eating.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix

programme.title: Homestead Rescue

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: As the wet season transforms Nsefu into a lush green paradise, Storm’s wild dog pups must learn to navigate their new, flooded world. Leopard mother Olimba clashes with her daughter Mutima, forcing her to grow up fast. The lion pride’s dominance intensifies, with devastating consequences for the hyena clan and their newborns. When Storm gives birth to a second litter, disaster strikes at the den, and with the lions closing in, the dogs’ place in the kingdom hangs in the balance. But even lions must remain vigilant in this crowded land.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Home potters compete to become the new champion of British pottery. Comedian Johnny Vegas, a former pupil of Kate Malone, demonstrates how to throw a teapot in just one minute.

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Liam Charles and Tom Allen set two chocolate-themed challenges for the four remaining teams in the third episode - and one of the tasks they will face has never been seen before in the show. For the climactic showpiece round, the teams are required to make a firework-themed creation, which must incorporate moving parts as well as featuring chocolate entremets. Judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finde will assess their efforts before deciding which three teams will be continuing to next weeks round

Unfortunately during the big clear out Teddy accidentally falls into a bin bag which gets put out in the street. Bean is horrified when the rubbish van arrives and he realises that dear old Teddy is now on his way to the landfill. Bean races across town to the dump but how will he ever find his friend amongst all the mountains of junk?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella always looks forward to Momella Day. And this Momella day promises to be the most interstellar yet, because they are going to see a small but powerful Red Dwarf star!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Priya has arrived from Earth to complete a school project about Mars. Priya is unfamiliar with the planet and a bit nervous about its huge dust storms. Ella, Slippy and Madhu convince her she needs to visit Mars to get the best video for her project.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Madhu has special presents for Ella and Slippy, to celebrate the anniversary of the day they met.But when Ella and Slippy say they can’t hang out, Madhu is sent off with only Maggie for company.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy has heard a rumour that the abandoned outpost the gang plans to visit is haunted so he brings his ghost detector goggles, just in case! Ella assures him that there are no such things as ghosts, but then odd things begin to happen.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ellas mum is a hall of fame Enceladus 500 race champion, and Ella wants to be just like her.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs run out of puff and decide to cut some corners. All it takes is a sharpie, as it happens; just change a wanted poster to offer a huge reward, and bingo! The public are gonna do your work for you. Weirdly quickly, a hard-boiled granny shows up with Lamput under her arm. Things turn ugly when she actually expects to be paid the reward. Most unreasonable. Not even an odd-jobs montage can pay this giant bill; the Docs get desperate and turn to crime, which works about as well for them as it usually does. Specs and Skinny end up in the clink, the granny pockets a heap of cash, and Lamput is yet again the one that got away.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Rattys brother comes to visit, Ratty has to pretend that he lives in Toad Hall as he had claimed in his letters. Ratty persuades Toad to be butler, and his friends reluctantly go along with it.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Mole goes to find Hedge in the Wild Woods without his glasses, the weasels play a nasty trick on him, and Mole falls into a ditch with Hedge. How will they ever get out to find Badger and get Moles glasses fixed?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad boasts he can get to the seaside in his hot air balloon and be back in time for his grand dinner. He soon gets into trouble and crash lands in the Wild Woods. Trapped in the ropes and branches of trees, Toad is helpless to stop the weasels marching on Toad Hall.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad commissions a portrait of himself from Mrs. Otter but cant keep still enough for her to paint him. Will there ever be a portrait of Toad hanging in Toad Hall?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Toad throws out an old chair, he immediately regrets it but the Weasels have now claimed it. Can Toad and his friends persuade them to return it to him?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When he brandishes a native american scepter that the Lemmings brought home with other antique objects, Grizzy sees the Lemmings bow low before him and behave like servants. One of them has escaped the spell, but he will have to confront both Grizzy and his fellow creatures in order to recover the scepter and reverse the spell.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy tries to impress the she-bear that hes in love with by making a sculpture of her from a piece of wood. But as soon as the artists back is turned, the Lemmings gnaw at the work of art in order to transform it into a toboggan slide. Grizzy must succeed in getting rid of the Lemmings without his model realizing whats going on. An Art in itself!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings throw a surprise birthday party for one of the clan.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A gust of wind sweeps away the flower that Grizzys adored she-bear wears in her hair. Grizzy sees this as a golden opportunity to dazzle her by bringing it back. But the Lemmings, who are riding on the back of a bucking caribou, realize that the flower makes their mount sneeze, which only makes the game ten times more fun!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds two identical vases in a Native American chest. They are communicating vessels, so if he sticks his hand in one, it comes out the other, regardless of the distance between them. This should satisfy Grizzys natural lazy streak, unless the Lemmings realise the incredible games they could play with the magic vases.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids must choose their hero name as they take on Cerealiak with the help of Mighty Moo.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build a castle for Elmer the Giant. They admire his toys and use them without his permission.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Buff befriends Mr Freezes snowcrawler Snowy, the other Batwheels bristle at the thought of hanging out with a "bad guy" so Buff sets out to change their minds.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After he causes the Batwing to crash, Bam becomes obsessed with making it up to her during a high-stakes aerial mission against Penguin and his giant ducky blimp.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby upgrades Bot to a Bot-y Guard. When Tom breaks in and sets off Bots defensive systems, things get out of control and Bot terrorizes the whole lab crew. Jerry and Napoleon must figure out how to disarm Bot without hurting him.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When the witches herb garden is destroyed, Tom sets a trap to capture the pest responsible. Quackers helps him but is unknowingly the pest Tom seeks to capture.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerry accidentally lose Gingers wedding ring down the drain, they send Jerry down the pipes to retrieve it, but it leads down the drain, to the sewers and out to the beach! The pets must keep Rick and Ginger from using the water until everything is back in order.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby creates an amazing helmet that accidentally turns Tom into a genius. Napoleon, Jerry and Hamster all work together to take down the newly smart Tom who is now building a mouse-destroying weapon.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Skinny might be a man of science, but he’s more than happy to get his fortune told for a laugh. The palm-reader sees alarming visions of Skinny’s near future; mostly visions that relate to Skinny being squashed, smooshed or otherwise smeared. It’s kind of Skinny’s own fault; maybe if he paid a bit less attention to chasing Lamput and a bit more attention to not getting squashed, smooshed or smeared, he wouldn’t need constant rescuing by a frazzled mystic.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is keen to own a brand new smart phone when he discovers all the wonderful things it can do. But after a trip to the mobile phone shop he is horrified at how much they cost and decides to build his own one. Bean’s phone may be bulky but it comes with a whole range of built in gadgets especially useful during a race to The Tower of London.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A clueless yet clever loner bungles his way through life in London. Mr Bean has some unexpected guests who think he runs a hotel!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: From competitive eating to channeling his inner superhero, Mr. Bean’s bungling antics land him in all sorts of new sticky situations this season.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidently causes Mrs Wicket to be hospitalised and in need of a wheelchair. Back home Mr Bean has thoughtfully set up a bell service so that he can be at Mrs Wicket’s beck and call at any time of day or night. Mrs Wicket likes this...a lot. The bell doesn’t stop ringing and an exhausted Mr Bean finds himself running up and down the stairs carrying and fetching until he eventually loses patience with his patient.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean ends up on stage at the opera house...in a dress!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput’s been caught! The Docs don’t have much to do now but to give tours to visiting students. Until one of these students, Tuzki specifically, gets lost. Will Tuzki find his way back to class? Not unless Lamput has something to do with it.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: While trying to escape from the Docs at a small sea side town, Lamput meets a lonely sea monster. Lamput attempts to help the sea monster makes friends but all his plans backfires. Now the locals are enraged, and the docs take the opportunity to stir up an angry mob to take down the creature and catch Lamput in the process! Not unless Lamput’s new friend has anything to say about it.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Boss takes on a particularly enormous sailor in a seedy underground arm wrestling tournament. Who knew old Boss such grit?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings prepare a dream afternoon snack with the last jar of chocolate spread in the cupboard.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy gleefully discovers that he can print images taken with the rangers camera which is connected to a state-of-the-art printer. He decides to immortalize and frame himself…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A van pulls up to the rangers cabin to deliver a crate of jars of chocolate spread. While Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over a wrecking bar to open it, someone steals the crate.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: As usual Grizzy picks the door of the Rangers log cabin to come in and make himself comfortable but this time its impossible to enter!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have got their hands on a pack of white beans which have very strange properties: when mixed with soda, anyone who eats them turns into a bouncing ball. Grizzy realizes that if he wants to take a nap, he must first get rid of the magic beans.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings are having a blast with a bowling game they found in the Rangers storeroom. Grizzy hastens to destroy the pins to ensure his peace and quiet. But the Lemmings discover a remote-control device that can modify the balls weight. By setting it on maximum, the ball could knock over much more than pins: furniture, a bear and even a log cabin!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After Jerry mocks up a "Reward If Found" poster for Tom with the address of a neighbor with a ferocious dog, some good Samaritans bring Tom "home." Now, Tom has to escape from the house with his nine lives intact before hes brought back again and again.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Hildie and Beatie believe theyve had a few of their things stolen, they employ a little magic to create Bog, the Cottage Beast. In order to prove that Bog is overkill, however, Tom and Jerry must confess to borrowing the "stolen" goods to beat up on each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry Tom and Spike need rescuing on their snowy vacation.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom gets a can of Cat Cop a spray that creates a tiny cop.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its Spikes birthday and he has been counting the days down. Every year, Rick goes all out to make it special, but not this one. He has forgotten! Seeing how sad Spike is, Tom and Jerry work together to give the pooch a birthday to remember. Unfortunately, their every effort backfires -- but dont worry, it ends happily.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A mockingbird has taken roost in a tree outside Gingers window, where it sings the sweetest songs whenever shes around. When she leaves for work, however, the mockingbird earns its name by mocking Tom and Jerry relentlessly. When her nest full of eggs hatches and the insults really take flight, Tom, Jerry and even Spike, decide its time for these birds to fly the coop!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When Scrapper claws a rip in Teddy, Mr Bean rushes him to the Teddy hospital. As Teddy is being fixed, Mr Bean is rather taken with another Ted on sale in the shop. He decided to take Big Ted home with him once Teddy is fixed. But at home it seems as though Big Ted is freezing Teddy out, and after a particularly terrifying nightmare, Mr Bean realises he has to get rid of his new guest.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean takes Billy to a climbing centre but gets annoyed by a competitive dad who accuses him of being a beginner. Mr Bean insists he’s an expert but is made to prove it when they both compete for a trophy – the winner being the first to climb “The Big One”, a huge, scary wall for adults only! Mr Bean is determined to win but hadn’t counted on the competitive dad’s dirty tricks!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: How does one choose tasteful wallpaper these days? After watching a royal documentary on TV, Mr. Bean decides to decorate his room in the style of Buckingham Palace. If the Queen’s new wallpaper is good enough for Her Royal Highness, then it’s going to be good enough for him. Meanwhile, his landlady, Mrs. Wicket, suffers from illusions of grandeur and crowns herself Queen of the street.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean finds himself in a race to grow a giant marrow with his next-door neighbour. There’s prize money at stake and a chance to get his photo in the papers. And so, as the competition gets tough, Bean’s gardening techniques become more ingenious, unconventional and desperate.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean loses a stranger’s engagement ring and has to get it back in time for the proposal!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is watering Mr Paliwal’s precious plant while he’s on holiday… what could possibly go wrong?!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When the bin men refuse to collect Mr Bean’s bin, he tries to trick them into taking it.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Everyone seems to be going on holiday apart from Mr Bean, so he decides to recreate one at home!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: At a funfair, Mr Bean wins a balloon for Teddy and ties it to him while he plays on the hook a duck. But he’s so engrossed he doesn’t notice his companion floating away! Soon Mr Bean is chasing Teddy as he glides and snags on various fairground rides. Will Mr Bean rescue Teddy before he floats away forever?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket has just inherited an antique grandfather clock – Mr Bean is impressed! But he soon starts to resent it when it bongs loudly on the hour all through the night. Desperate for sleep as dawn is breaking, he fiddles inside the clock, only for it to fall apart and onto the floor! Can he get the bulky heirloom to a repair shop and back before Mrs Wicket wakes up?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and the jewel thief have a lot in common. They are both round and blue. Also they both like accelerating into blind corners. A full-speed collision results in an accidental identity mixup - suddenly the thief finds himself with a real job at the Lab, and poor old Specs is being used as bedding by a hulking prison inmate. When Lamput decides to open up a can of kick-butt, the thief starts to wonder if a life of crime might be safer after all. Specs has no doubt at all where hed prefer to be. Lamput unveils a surprising skill at the kung-fu nerve-pinch. Specs is busted out of the clink, and returns to the life he loves: sprinting alongside his best bud Skinny, constantly failing to catch ol Lamput.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: In an accident during a chase, Lamput ends up getting stuck to Specs! Since they are literally inseparable, they bond over time until Boss commands Specs to return to the Lab.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput decides to help distressed duck parents find their missing children. But the ducklings are too much for him to handle!

programme.desc: Feeling insecure about his size after a game of Hide-And-Seek, Buff uses the shrink belt belonging to The Atom and accidentally shrinks himself down to the size of a mouse!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.desc: Because of an injured foot, Rick stays home with Gingers mother, Rosemary, taking care of him. When he offers Tom and Jerry a cut of the money to keep his secret, they take it and agree to train him—but it wont be easy.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.desc: Mr Bean has to deal with an unwanted house guest but the stubborn pest refuses to leave.

programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr Bean. Mr Bean enters a competition to win a trolley of free food!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.desc: The Looney Builders discover Zippy, an acrobatic flea, living on Sylvester’s back. They build Zippy a flea circus to try and convince him to relocate and relieve Sylvester’s itch.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is enlisted to pet sit Buttons, a friend’s dog, on the very day she has to finish a school project about Venus. She decides to take on both responsibilities at once by taking Buttons with her to the planet to capture the final piece of video footage she needs. When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. It’s Buttons who finds Ella! Ella admits she shouldn’t have taken her furry friend with her, but at least she learned new facts for her project!

programme.desc: Toad commissions a portrait of himself from Mrs. Otter but cant keep still enough for her to paint him. Will there ever be a portrait of Toad hanging in Toad Hall?

programme.title: Lamput

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: When Lamput disguises himself as a book and gets returned to the Library, the Docs have to be super quiet in their attempts to get him back. They finally manage to sneak past the Librarian, but all chaos erupts when they open a mysterious book in the restricted area. Lamput and the Docs have to team up to get the new ghostly resident back to where he belongs!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Boss shows he’s still got it in the inventin’ department by coming up with a brain-swapping raygun. Just what the world needs. The Boss’ glory is short lived, though, when the raygun starts going off randomly. The Boss and Lamput trade places, and we get to see what it looks like when the worst boss in the world can also freak you out by morphing into orange stuff. Everyone’s acting topsy turvy, so it’s up to Specs and Skinny to straighten things out. Lucky those guys don’t have brains to swap.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off a Canadian army convoy. Inside, a case emits a sort of laser beam that divides objects into multiple miniaturized versions of themselves.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Near the supermarket a machine hands out surprise eggs in exchange for a coin. Amongst the lots to be won, there is a super firework rocket the Lemmings dream of, and a piece of costume jewelry that Grizzy imagines himself giving to his lady-love.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy uses the rangers new gadget to become a smarter bear. But first, he wants to learn how to get rid of his obnoxious houseguests.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: An old metal box found by chance in a recess of a cliff brings back childhood memories for Grizzy and the Lemmings.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs run out of puff and decide to cut some corners. All it takes is a sharpie, as it happens; just change a wanted poster to offer a huge reward, and bingo! The public are gonna do your work for you. Weirdly quickly, a hard-boiled granny shows up with Lamput under her arm. Things turn ugly when she actually expects to be paid the reward. Most unreasonable. Not even an odd-jobs montage can pay this giant bill; the Docs get desperate and turn to crime, which works about as well for them as it usually does. Specs and Skinny end up in the clink, the granny pockets a heap of cash, and Lamput is yet again the one that got away.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Boss is writing his new novel but he finds it extremely hard to focus with all the noise and disturbance at the lab. Looking for some tranquillity, Boss finally settles inside the old cannon at launch pad of the lab and accidentally gets fired out all the way to the moon!! It’s completely quiet on the moon, just what Boss needs. He can’t stop writing. Back at the lab, they build a rocket to bring Boss back! Hopefully boss gets to finish his novel first.

programme.title: Lamput

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger are asked to dog-sit for a friends French poodle, Sabrina, Tom is initially on his guard, but soon hes practically eating out of her hand. programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Sometimes Mr. Bean’s Teddy can be no fun at all. Feeling the need for a new friend, Bean buys a parrot. But getting the parrot past his landlady and her one-eyed cat, Scrapper, proves to be no easy task. Next, is trying to get the blasted bird to speak.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput spends the day at the beach, and, in a pair of swimming trunks, cuts a fine figure indeed. That is to say; a small, round and blobby figure. It only takes one snide comment from a fellow beach-goer to bring Lamputs body issues to the surface. When youre a shape changer, though, theres no need for exercise; before long Lamput is strutting along as an orange amalgam of all the best-looking sunbakers. On the up side, its a handy disguise when the Docs come a-hunting. On the down side? Well, its kind of tiring pretending to be someone youre not. Lamput learns an important lesson from a nearby blobby little girl. Be yourself, and if anyones got a problem with that, they can go find their own patch of sand.

programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the ranger’s collection of bird calls by chance. With a simple blow of the whistle, he can attract a flock of partridges that are at his beck and call.

programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun taking potshots at sand statues depicting Grizzy. Outraged, he catapults them far into the distance. programme.desc: After being hit over the head, the Lemmings become hypnotized by a fitness poster and take themselves for sports coaches. They are determined to forcefully train Grizzy, who would much rather lounge around than do push-ups and squats.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Nothing seems to be biting Grizzys fishing rod and the bear is in despair. Suddenly he spots a fabulous swordfish swimming in the lagoon.

programme.desc: The Lemmings discover that several drops of Tabasco sauce poured into a rock fault releases powerful sprays of steam that propel them high into the sky on a pot lid.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has run out of ideas to open his coconut until he sees the Lemmings new friend the crab open one with a simple snip of the claw. He confiscates the crustacean and uses it to take the tops off his coconuts. As they fight over the crab, the characters discover a remote-control device in a secret grotto that operates a giant crab. Grizzy takes over the controls, but the Lemmings want to play with the joystick too!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A helicopter takes off from the beach, leaving behind installations for a TV game, namely lots of food supplies – which are locked up. To access the keys and the food, participants must win team tests under the surveillance of a drone. The Lemmings are the yellow team. The red team is comprised of Grizzy, an oar, and a flabbergasted crab!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Everyone is ecstatic when Bibi, Batgirl, and Robin capture Toyman and his Do-Over remote - except for Bibi, who failed to stick the landing on a big jump. Unwilling to accept her failure, Bibi uses Toymans Do-Over remote until she perfects her jump!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Bam is sent out to take on Prank, Redbird asks to join the fight, but Bam insists he hangs back - that Vans too dangerous!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After Jestah’s insults get the best of her, a short-tempered Bibi tries to not let the big-wheeled bullys words get to her so she can help Batgirl catch Harley.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Feeling neglected after being passed over on missions, Bam asks MOE to install experimental upgrades to curry Batmans favor. But, when Bams new powers are stronger than he can control, Batman – and the mission – are suddenly in danger!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired to build an outdoor movie theater in the park. / The Looney Builders discover Zippy, an acrobatic flea, living on Sylvester’s back.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When it starts to rain outside, Porky hopes to show The Looney Builders that they can still have fun inside by building a fort.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build a castle for Elmer the Giant. They admire his toys and use them without his permission.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Fosse Ferret hires The Looney Builders to build a stage for the kids’ dance recital. / It’s Taz’s birthday, so The Looney Builders build him a huge ice cream sundae.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Maude tasks Tom with guarding her prize pumpkin until she enters it into competition at the county fair.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A battle ensues over who will control the Genie that emerges from an antic lamp Ginger brings home from a yard sale.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Cat and Mouse detectives are hired to track down Tuffys imaginary scapegoat, Mr. Nobody.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its the battle of the soldier angels when pranks run amok on April Fools Day.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom has trouble keeping track of a pinata full of stolen loot.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom is off to visit his grandma with a basket of goodies when he encounters a Wolf and a Witch on the same path to Grandmas house.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy’s Dad insists he get rid of all his inventions to free up some space. Slippy can’t bear to, so decides to store them on the dark side of Mercury.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: On Sedna, Ella and her friends discover the space probe Voyager 1. Ella takes the Golden Record from the probe and takes it to Mom who reveals that Ella’s greatest grandfather recorded a greeting on it!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Human Day is Ella’s favourite day of the year and she invites Madhu to join her family for dinner. Madhu wants to make a good impression and wonders how to prepare. With Maggie’s help, Madhu learns about the customs of different cultures.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While checking out a rogue planet, Ella, Slippy and Madhu crash onto its surface. When the heat from underground causes the planets icy crust to burst open, they all tumble down into the darkness and become separated.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones! But things don’t go quite as planned -- a lot has changed in space over the years.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Tinker comes up with a cunning plan for herself and Chief to be delivered as a parcel into Toad Hall. But the journey there proves to be more much more arduous than she could possibly imagine.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Chief agrees to accompany Toad on a day trip, but only if he can drive. Chiefs plan is to steal the car by throwing Toad out, but his erratic driving sees them perched precariously over the riverbank. Can they ever be friends now?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Hedge learns to play chess, she fails to win gracefully. Soon no-one will play with her!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty tries out his new snorkeling equipment, but Portly mistakes him as the River Monster. An alarmed Hedge exaggerates the story, and Toad tries to catch the monster on camera as all the Riverbankers watch in anticipation.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: The weasels steal Ratty’s rowing boat but soon find themselves in trouble on a fast flowing river.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidentally swaps trunks with a magician with magical results!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean doesn’t like sharing the local soft play centre with a load of rowdy kids – so he goes home and builds his own house of fun.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean’s pizzas are a huge success with everyone – well almost everyone.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs a new passport photograph and goes to incredible lengths to get one.

programme.desc: The four bakers use their baking and building skills to make 3-D dinosaur cookies in the shape of a T-Rex, Velociraptor, Stegosaurus, Brontosaurus or Triceratops.

programme.title: 24 In 24: Last Chef Standing
programme.desc: The 11 remaining chefs are starting to feel the effects of cooking for seven straight hours. In a shift that tests resourcefulness, Michael Symon and Esther Choi ask the chefs to create a three-course meal worthy of a black-tie event in 60 minutes. But the chefs will have to be resourceful with more than just their time -- ingredients like strawberry milk, pimento cheese, carrot tops, dried scallops, Carolina reaper peppers and shell-on pistachios must also be incorporated into their meal. How they use the ingredients is up to them, but then its up to judge Jet Tila to decide which chef will be clocking out.

programme.desc: Approximately 51 percent of the U.S. population is made up of women, but on "Outnumbered" the female advantage jumps to a 4-1 ratio. programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Explore the historical origins of things we use in everyday life, from modern medicine to weapons of mass destruction, and from sports stadiums to tools of astrology.

programme.title: Unidentified: Inside Americas UFO Investigation
programme.desc: In 2018, The New York Times ran a front-page story on a secret government programme that studied UFOs and the threat of alien invasion. This programme ran from 2007 to 2012 and allegedly compiled a trove of evidence into a 600-page report.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: A range of geology, climatology and archaeology experts give their conclusions as to what life could be like on Earth if the human race dies out.

programme.title: Serial Killer Earth
programme.desc: With the aid of a team of experts and eyewitness testimony, ‘Serial Killer Earth’ delves deep into the destructive power of natural disasters, and in the process explains how they compare with natural disasters of the past.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Alex Lagina joins Kevin Dykstra and his team in their quest to find 140 million dollars in Confederate gold they believe is on the bottom of Lake Michigan and on their first day back on the lake, new evidence suggests they may have found it.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: River Hunters sees Rick Edwards and river-searching expert Beau Ouimette searching the unexplored rivers and waterways of Britain, unearthing treasures from the past which reveal how our ancestors used to live.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: It’s been said that our universe is a cosmic shooting gallery. Gravity is moving everything around and things are bound to collide. Astronomers are attempting to understand how these collisions occur in the dark recesses of space. Learn about collisional families, which are clusters of comets and asteroids; planetary collisions; mass extinction impacts involving asteroids and comets; stars collisions; and galaxy cluster collisions. Cutting-edge computer graphics are used to bring this series down to earth as the heavens yield their greatest secrets.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: This season kicks off with an investigation into the last battle to have taken place on British soil: the battle of Culloden in 1746, on the outskirts of the capital of the Highlands, Inverness.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Mining the earth for coal, erecting drilling rigs for oil and natural gas to pipe to our homes, smelting iron ore into buildings of iron and steel - all of these are fundamentals of the modern industrialised world, but they are nothing new.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: The team unearths evidence of a secret tunnel while new clues suggest a deeper mystery than just the missing Confederate gold.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: In major cities around the world today, skyscrapers loom overhead, taxis honk their horns and street vendors peddle their wares. But below lies city upon city. ‘Cities of the Underworld’ explores this fascinating and unknown history.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Explore the mysteries of the most read book in human history. Featuring stunning photography, compelling reenactments and insightful interviews, Bible Secrets Revealed offers an eye-opening journey into the pages of the word of God.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: Rick Edwards and Beau Ouimette head to north Wales to investigate waterways that may contain signs of the medieval Welsh Rebellion. Conwy Castle was constructed by Edward I between 1283-1287 after the Welsh Rebellion of 1282-3. The castle was part of a chain of fortifications known as the Iron Ring of Castles and was both a material and symbolic sign of English power and dominance. Edward I selected its site on a high rock perched above the estuary of the River Conwy so that the castle could be supplied by the river in times of siege. Day two finds the pair at Ruthin Castle, a medieval fortress overlooking the River Clwyd.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Many years before modern air travel, the ancient Chinese had learned and were practising the complicated principles of fluid and aerodynamics in the kites they flew, the boats they sailed and the children’s toys they made.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: In April 1897, an unidentified craft crashed in Aurora, Texas. Locals claimed they buried the spaceship and its alien pilot. Can a new search uncover the remains?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: Chasing accounts of giant skeleton discoveries, Jim and Bill Vieira follow in the footsteps of Abraham Lincoln, who was fascinated by tales and legends of ancient colossi.

programme.title: Clash Of The Gods
programme.desc: The epic tragedy of Medusa, the most infamous female fiend in Greek mythology whose look turned every living thing to stone. But what is the true story behind the myth? Are there clues in the night sky to the origins of the tale?

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

Conwy Castle was constructed by Edward I between 1283-1287 after the Welsh Rebellion of 1282-3. The castle was part of a chain of fortifications known as the Iron Ring of Castles and was both a material and symbolic sign of English power and dominance. Edward I selected its site on a high rock perched above the estuary of the River Conwy so that the castle could be supplied by the river in times of siege. Day two finds the pair at Ruthin Castle, a medieval fortress overlooking the River Clwyd.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Many years before modern air travel, the ancient Chinese had learned and were practising the complicated principles of fluid and aerodynamics in the kites they flew, the boats they sailed and the children’s toys they made.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: In April 1897, an unidentified craft crashed in Aurora, Texas. Locals claimed they buried the spaceship and its alien pilot. Can a new search uncover the remains?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: Chasing accounts of giant skeleton discoveries, Jim and Bill Vieira follow in the footsteps of Abraham Lincoln, who was fascinated by tales and legends of ancient colossi.

programme.title: Clash Of The Gods
programme.desc: The epic tragedy of Medusa, the most infamous female fiend in Greek mythology whose look turned every living thing to stone. But what is the true story behind the myth? Are there clues in the night sky to the origins of the tale?

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Many mysteries of planet Earth are far from understood. How was Devils Tower formed? Or why do some people get struck by lightning multiple times? While some may write off these as random occurrences, might they instead point to a new understanding?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: The Founding Fathers established the pillars of US freedom and democracy. Centuries later, new revelations emerge about their complexities, agendas, and hidden truths. What secrets lie behind the men who shaped America?

programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum saddle up and head deep into the heart of Texas! In Fort Worth, the trio unearths a treasure trove including a rare Gretsch White Penguin guitar, a Smith And Wesson revolver, and a "Wonder Man" comic signed by Stan Lee.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are making big deals in the smallest state! In Providence, Rhode Island, the guys cruise over to a muscle car collection, check out a rare book written by John Adams, and take aim at a harpoon gun.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Dr. Jacques Vallee is best known for his revolutionary work in the field of UFOs, and his bold theories challenge our notions of alien life. Will his incredible work lead to answers about what has been happening in our skies for thousands of years?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Talismans are seen as providing protection and good fortune. Some are even thought to embody a higher power. Could it be that what fuels our faith in talismans is not superstition, but a real connection to something beyond our world?

programme.desc: Did a Swedish teenager photograph some of the most convincing UFO evidence ever? Is a video posted online showing a pterodactyl-like creature flying over Idaho the real deal? Why are headless goats repeatedly being dumped in an Atlanta River?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In Iraq and Syria, thousands of ancient artifacts and relics have been deliberately destroyed. In the highlands of Tibet and the jungles of Central America, sacred texts have been systematically destroyed. Could this all be by design?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum rack up points testing the merchandise at a pinball paradise; Corey saddles up to a piece of World War II history; Chum sleuths out a sale on a set of Sherlock Holmes books; Rick welcomes Guns N Roses guitarist, ASHBA.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Discover new words and join in the activities with Timmy and his friends in this fun learning series developed by Aardman and the British Council, world expects in teaching English.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messys hiccups cause a landslide while out on a nature walk, will he be able to find his way home? And will he ever stop hiccuping?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy has to deliver the giant pongberry to the Pongberry Pie Festival, before it goes off and releases a terrible pong in Okido City!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry accidentally smashes his mums favourite china teacup.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry needs help making up a story to go with his new drawing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: While lounging against a tree, Kyle engages in a whimsical conversation with his trusty toy kangaroo, Stella. Suddenly, a tiny lizard approaches him, sparking his curiosity. Eager to get a closer look, Kyles approach startles the lizard, causing it to gracefully glide away to another tree. Bursting with excitement, Kyle immediately contacts his fellow Junior Rangers, Leo and Katie. Meanwhile, Leo and Katies kite-flying adventure takes a nosedive when their kite crashes to the ground. Amidst the disappointment, Leo receives a call from Kyle, who excitedly shares his encounter with the mysterious creature. The Junior Rangers identify it as a Flying Draco Lizard and agree to rendezvous at Kyles location. As they arrive, Kyle accidentally tumbles from the branch but lands safely in a bush. Undeterred, they embark on a quest to find the elusive lizard. Along the way, Kyles insistence on spotting a small dragon sparks a playful argument with Katie, who refutes his claim. Suddenly, their eyes lock onto a branch, where the Flying Draco Lizard perches, unaware of a larger threat approaching. Just in the nick of time, Ranger Rocky, equipped with his trusty paraglider, joins forces with the Junior Rangers. They inform him of the perilous situation, prompting Ranger Rocky to contact his knowledgeable friend, Ranger Joey.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: The first time Samson came to Sodor he got lost. But Samson is a very proud engine and he doesn’t like to admit his mistakes. So he finds it very hard to listen to the other engines trying to warn him that he is making a mistake again when he accidentally takes Gordon’s Express Coaches to the quarry, instead of the trucks used for carrying stone.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Scruff breaks down and has to be sent to the Steamworks, Samson is given the job of collecting up the track-side scrap. But Samson ends up taking his new responsibilities a little too seriously and collects up everything from the postman’s bike to the Fat Controller’s car. The Fat Controller has to race off to save it before it ends up getting crunched by Reg’s claw!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has to look after Thingy while his mistress Olivia is away. Grisu has to take the dog to the pet grooming shop to take a bath. But Thingy is a stubborn dog. He refuses to move forward. Grisu And Stella will have to use kindness and to be smart enough to drive the dog through the town. Without listening to his father Fume, who tries to make him use his dragon flame...

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The shooting of the movie “The monster of the Valley”, directed by the famous Quintin Ratatino, is going badly. A fire has destroyed his mechanical monster and his film crew has deserted the scene. Grisu and Stella help to save the movie. Grisu takes on the role of the monster and Stella helps with the technique. But playing the main part in a Ratatino’s movie is not that easy, evenmore when the director asks Grisu to play the role... of a nasty dragon!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger and Rosie are determined to find out who are the best, between badgers and foxes! As they have to watch over Berry all day, they agree to pick the winner between the two of them by each teaching their little sister their best techniques to catch insects! But with so much time spent challenging each other, they forget about Berry and eventually have to combinetheir different skills to manage to get her out of a very risky predicament...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this rainforest adventure, Peyo, while collecting colorful flowers, encounters a tiny, vibrant Poison Dart Frog. Pico goes into protective mode, preventing Peyo from getting too close to the potentially dangerous frog. He calls Leo and Katie, who checks on the computer and learns about Poison Dart Frogs, emphasizing their toxic nature. The frog suddenly jumps into Peyo’s satchel which calls for the team to travel to the rainforest to address the situation. As they arrive, Leo manages to get the frog out of the satchel with his grabber but the frog ends up jumping around which causes a commotion with everyone being scared to get too close. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky shows up and the frog is nowhere to be found! On high alert, they look around for the frog which ends up being on Ranger Rocky’s hat which he gently places on the ground and Peyo retrieves his satchel safely. However, the frog then jumps onto Hero’s backpack and gets flung onto a floating leaf in a river, prompting a rescue mission as they learnt that the frog is not a good swimmer. Using quick thinking and Peyo’s satchel, the Junior Rangers save the frog and find a suitable spot for it to rest by the river. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the frog while Katie commends Hero’s smelling skills and deems them better than Leo’s.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the deserts of Africa, Jane and Zumi take a break from patrolling. While Jane dozes off, Zumi detects a disturbance - a baby hyena in distress. Despite trying to wake Jane, Zumi decides to investigate alone, following the baby hyena as it walks aimlessly, further away. In the garden, Leo, Katie, and Hero are trying to make each other laugh and whoever laughs first, will have to mow the lawn. Katie ends up losing for laughing at her own joke but is saved from mowing with a call from Jane. Alarmed by Zumi missing, they travel to Africa to help Jane. Zumis disappearance prompts a search using a sound detector and Katie’s tablet to pick up sounds from far away and after hearing from different animals, they finally capture the laugh of the baby hyena! They head towards the sound and stumble upon Ranger Rocky who startled them with a lion’s roar. After learning about hyenas from Ranger Joey, Ranger Joey mentions a lion finishing its meal and Katie suggests that the hyenas might show up for its leftovers. Hence, the rangers head towards the leftovers and as predicted, a clan of hyenas show up and the baby hyena immediately runs towards them, ending in a loving embrace with its mother. Back at the treehouse, Leo calls it mission accomplished and teases Katie who is disgruntled, mowing the lawn.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is having fun with Gaspard in the tree house but Daddy comes to tell them it’s bed time. Simon says, hey, why can’t we sleep in the tree house? Nothing doing, Simon has to go off to bed in the house. But it’s not over til it’s over! With Gaspard, they are going to spend the night in the cabin. Period! Their secret mission to escape from the house has begun. They’ve just got to make sure mom and dad don’t catch them!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly gets a present but they start a fight to posess it. Finally turns out that they got a tandem bicycle.
