programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda dreams of learning to fly. Excited by Robin Robins statement that anyone with wings can fly, Tilda makes herself some from lettuce leaves. Robin is supposed to give her flying instruction, but she gets bored with all the tedious theory. Molly gets Rupert to help persuade Tilda flying is a bad idea.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Today’s the annual Kite Festival, but there is no wind. So, Rupert builds a wind machine. The machine breaks and the improved version creates such a strong wind not only the kites go flying…

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna has a new business idea: restoring old furniture. When the twins Billy and Benny play with paint, they accidentally splatter Robin’s favourite cabinet. Edna is shocked, but Robin loves the result.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: A foot race is going to take place at school tomorrow. Ferdinand is convinced that he is going to win. This bugs Simon big-time because he is just as convinced he will win. After all, Simon is the fastest! Especially if he is wearing his “fastest t-shirt in the world”, the one with the lightning bolt on it! He puts it on at home that evening and sure enough, he does everything super-duper fast. He eats in a blink, brushes his teeth at the speed of light. But the next morning at school, while all the other kids are putting on their gym clothes, Simon realizes that his fetish t-shirt isn’t in his bag!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A barn owl scares Leo in the garden. The Junior Rangers depart for the grasslands to find a better hunting place for the barn owl.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across a baby Asian elephant while planting an apple tree. To find the elephant’s mother, the Junior Rangers explore the lowland forest.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn his Training Badge, Wilson must teach Hoot and Toot how to use the paint car. Unfortunately, he’s so busy demonstrating how good he is at painting, he doesn’t teach them anything. He realises his mistake when time is nearly up – he should have been showing them instead of showing off! Wilson sadly goes through a list of all the things he should have taught them. Hoot and Toot listen closely and surprise Wilson by passing their test. Wilson earns his badge after all!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster learns about camouflage when he repaints the lizard’s house.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina’s drawing of a rainbow, Tchoupi lists out all the colors within it. When he gets it wrong, Nina suggests they turn it into a game and look for the various hues in Nature. Loving the idea, Mom suggests they go find the colors on the flowers and vegetables in the hamlet. Nina and Tchoupi come back in next to no time, mission accomplished! Recognizing their talent, Dad ups the stakes, setting them the challenge of spotting the rainbow colors… among the animals! Mmm, easier said than done…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi chances upon an old Polaroid camera while rummaging through a chest, Dad sees it as a perfect opportunity to do an animal photo safari in the forest! T’choupi, Nina and Luce love the idea; Luce, especially, is excited at the (unlikely) prospect of spotting a baby tiger! Unfortunately, the animals are difficult to find, keeping themselves to themselves, but the kids manage in the end to take a bunch of cute wildlife photos. All of a sudden, a mysterious creature pokes its snout out between two rocks... Could it be a baby tiger…?!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Fred has found some bowling pins he had as a child. He asks T’choupi and Nina if they want to play but they turn him down, finding the game too old. But when Dad arrives on the scene, his face lights up as soon as he sets eyes on the pins: he had this same game when he was little, and used to love playing it! Seeing their nostalgic dads playing, T’choupi and Nina realize that they too would like to join in. But their fathers are having so much fun that they don’t dare disturb them… Maybe they could make their own bowling pin game, instead…?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: For todays activity, Medhi has brought along some carnivorous plants. But since the plants have been in the vegetable garden, lots of things have been disappearing! A barrette, a marble, an adorable caterpillar! Could it be that the plants have eaten everything?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia dream of seeing snow falling in the yard of the Mouse Mansion. They decide to do everything they can to make this happen. But such a thing is not so simple, as they will find out!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Daisy the railcar can carry passengers without having to pull any coaches. So, when Thomas is sent to work in the quarry for a spell and Daisy takes on his usual responsibilities, Annie and Clarabel are left behind. Daisy takes every opportunity to remind Annie and Clarabel that, as long as she is working Thomas’s branch line, they are not needed. But, when Daisy becomes popular with her passengers, she has to pull some passenger coaches after all! Annie and Clarabel get their own back by tricking Daisy into thinking she is need of repair. But two wrongs don’t make a right and Annie and Clarabel only end up being left behind in a siding… and then pulled along by dirty old Diesel! *Cough! Cough!*

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. Donald and Douglas keep squabbling about which line they should clear first, culminating in a big argument. Donald pulls away hard, snapping a damaged coupling and moving away with Douglas’s tender! So Douglas is left behind in the snow – without coal or water! The time apart helps cool the brothers’ tempers. They are delighted to be reunited in the end – and share water and coal from their tenders. Brothers!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou tells his class about the exciting BBQ he had on the weekend!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou has been tasked with reading Rosie a bedtime story. Hetells her classic fairytales, with a Caillou-twist, but gets tooexcited and spooks her with stories of bears and wolves - wakingRosie up instead of putting her to sleep. Finally, he gets luckywhen he combines all the tales into one special story.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: What a drama, Monkey’s twig boat drifted away in to the lake. Monkey was sure it was gone when his friend Duck saved the day and brought it back to shore. Of course seeing duck in action gave Monkey a brilliant idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: What would be a better place for Monkey’s precious treasure then in the pouch of his best friend the Kangaroo? Kangaroo not only agrees to keep the treasure, he is also willing to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”! The whole savanna shakes as kangaroo shows Monkey and the children how to jump, move their hands and check their pouches just like kangaroos. Jump aboard and some hot savanna fun!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah and Mandy film a piece for the Scoop Dooley Show, and Scoop Dooley tries to make everything more sensational.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a mission to rescue Luc the wild boar, Moose ends up needing a rescue himself - and the multi - vehicle rescue gives Ellie a chance to show the Fire Cadets the importance of being slow and careful in a firefighter’s tasks.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When the Super Cluepers discover an old magnifying glass that seems to have belonged to some junior detectives, they set off to find out more about these mysterious detectives. It’s only when they put their clues together in the right way do they realize that the answer is right in front of them – the junior detectives were actually Mrs. Beaver, Mr. Groundhog and Mr. Mole when they were kids! / When Franklin and friends discover the last page of their Dynaroo comic missing, they set out on a search to find it, and the ending they’ve been so looking forward to reading. It’s only when their search leaves them empty-handed, do they ‘save the day’ by putting their heads together and making up their very own ending.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Out on a walk, Scoutbadger, Rosie and Woodsy discover a mysterious unknown tunnel. While the first two are ready to explore it right away, Woodsy has more reservations. He would rather do things by the book: an exploration journey needs to be prepared! Soon, his brother and sister are taken aback by his behavior. Woodsy looks worried, not to say downright scared.Out of fear, he acts erratically, leading them to all end up stuck in a cul-de-sac.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who can see really well at night? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw owl.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What lives in a garden and is busy during the Spring? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a bee.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Whats the best thing we can do while we wait for Christmas? Doodleboo explains to Sketchy how to draw a snowman.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make up a song of jungle animal noises. Listening carefully to the sounds their jungle friends make, they learn how to ‘Oooh-Oooh-ooh’ like a monkey, ‘kaw’ like a parrot and ‘roar’ like a Leopard - and everyone joins them in singing their special Jungle Song!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn different ways to stay safe. Hatty shows them how to be safe when crossing a road, boating and doing construction work. Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help keep others safe too, when they repair a broken road sign to warn the Sheep about danger on the road up ahead!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks. When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Everyone knows what happens when a bull sees red, but do you know what happens when he sees red flowers? Ask Monkey, his friend the bull came to visit just as he was picking beautiful red flowers at the farm, do you know what happened? They ended up playing Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman and Hannah are organizing a pool party for Peter, but Mike drops some decorations onto a lantern, and soon the rescue team needs to be called.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The bream has gone missing from the fish counter at the Wholefish Cafe, and Detective James is determined to crack The Case of the Missing Fish.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to make lemonade that both looks and tastes great. In Mimiloo, Lily has opened her dream cafe, and wants everything to be perfect for a visit from the Queen of the Bunniflies. But when some of her preparations fall apart, it’s up to Kate to show her that things don’t have to be perfect to be great.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to win at pin the tail on the donkey, but she misses. In Mimiloo, Kate and Mim-Mim want to race against their new friend, Auggie the Froggie, in a leapfrog race. Tack gives Kate a pair of Hoppy Socks so she can jump above Mim-Mim, but they give her an unfair advantage!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is sad when he learns that Plume the rabbit has hurt her paw. He and Nina decide to take their little furry friend into T’choupi’s bedroom: she’ll be safe in there and able to get a good rest while they take good care of her. T’choupi’s certain this is a good solution. But little does he know… cheeky little Plume has other ideas…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: It’s Father’s Day today. But neither T’choupi nor Nina can come up with a good idea for a special present for their respective dads. Benedicte suggests they gather up various objects from the forest and make "drawings" with them, on the ground. Great idea… except land art turns out to be a bit more complicated than they expected. And, more importantly, are their dads even going to like it?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia lost her lucky seashell, brought back from her island. Sam helps her find it. The investigation leads them to the home of Mrs. Dreamer, the Mansions clairvoyant mouse. But can she really help?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Noises on the roof prevented Julia from sleeping last night. Those noises were made by Miss Astro that observe the night sky. Julia get nostalgic of the sky she could admire on her island...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: On the beach, the Triplets are playing with Mommy’s bag, she scolds them nicely and tells them it’s time to go home ! But when she reaches for the keys, they are not here anymore ! They probably fell off the bag when the Triplets were playing with it. They have to find the keys or therwise everyone will have to sleep on the beach tonight - which by the way, sound good to the Triplets. Maybe raking the beach could be useful? Or then metal detectors, which would allow to find all the keys of the beach.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are watching a movie on television, when Poet starts to ask Mommy "How do you make a movie ?", she answers him that you need actors band a director to lead them and make the movie. Poet is very excited, when he’s a grown up, he wants to be a director and make animal documentaries. But his brother and sister do not agree with that, they want Poet to film them doing stunt, in a castle, with Dragons and sleeping beauties. Poor Poet will have to comply with the tantrums of his actors, not easy to do movies.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger have plans to go play with their friends, but before they go, they must bring back mushrooms for dinner. The twins grab their map indicating their secret spots to pick up mushrooms, but Rosie makes fun of them: she doesn’t need a map, thanks to her super fox sense of smell! She heads one way and the badgers go another. But none of themcan find a single mushroom worth eating!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to Sarah’s house to celebrate LunarNewYear with her family. He wears a brand-new red jumper, tries lots of tasty new food that bring luck,and learns how to use chopsticks.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Mommy doesnt let Caillou buy a chocolate bar, he takes thingsinto his own hands - literally! He wrestles with his conscience andstruggles with the guilt of stealing, and learns a valuable lesson.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: A storm has left the Safari Park in a bit of chaos, and some animals have escaped! Emery teases Brewster, saying one of the escapees is a dragon. So when one of the fugitives - a golden bell frog - makes his home in a tunnel that amplifies his distinctive 3 - note croak into a mighty roar, the trainees are convinced that Emery is right! While they debate what to do, Zephie heads straight towards the other side of the tunnel. They have to stop her! When Zephie learns that there is a dragon in the tunnel, it is too much for her and she stalls and falls over.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko challenges Wilson to see if they can stay awake all night! Morning comes, and Wilson declares himself the winner - just as Vee gives him a job for the day: he’s going to be collecting the mail and taking it to the sorting office. While Koko sleeps in, poor Wilson struggles to keep his eyes open. Later, Koko overhears Vee tell Morgan that she’s worried about Wilson falling asleep on the job. Koko feels terrible. They should never have stayed up playing all night. She didn’t think about the consequences! Going in search of Wilson, she finds him fast asleep on a siding and wakes him up. But it’s too late; he’s already missed the deadline for getting it to the sorting office.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: For todays activity, Medhi has brought along some carnivorous plants. But since the plants have been in the vegetable garden, lots of things have been disappearing! A barrette, a marble, an adorable caterpillar! Could it be that the plants have eaten everything?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave listen out for some very strange noises in Hatty’s garden. Who or what is making the ‘Bang-Bang, Ting-ting-a-ling and Ratta-tat-tat’ sounds and will Dave’s ‘Blue Panda Idea,’ stop them from keeping Hatty awake at night?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is feeling a bit grumpy. He’s even refusing to play with Nina: our little hero is missing his grandparents and friends back home. But Mom reassures him: it’s normal to sometimes feel a little down when you’re away your loved - ones. To cheer him up, Dad suggests they make changes to the cottage, to remind him of his house back home, and his family! Tchoupi suddenly switches from feeling sad to feeling ecstatic! He’s eager to invite Nina to celebrate this happy day with him… but can’t find her anywhere! This gets him worrying: what if his friend took off because of how unkind he was to her this morning?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: At the base of the Andes Mountain, Peyo concocts a berry dip while Pico brings berries to him. Hearing a distressed animal, he finds an animal trapped inside a cave with its entrance blocked by a fallen tree. In the Garden, a duckling follows Hero around which Hero reacts by hiding behind Leo. They receive a call from Peyo and identify the animal as a Guanaco through the computer. With PlatypusOne, they reach the mountain, use a winch to free the Guanaco, discovering its a chulengo - a young guanaco. The chulengo follows Peyo closely, much to Peyo’s confusion. They decide that the chulengo should be with its family but they’re unsure how to transport it as it is afraid of PlatypusOne. Dumbfounded, they stumble upon Ranger Rocky who seeks Ranger Joeys advice. Ranger Joey explains Guanaco social structures and adaptations. The chulengo nudges Peyo which causes him to trip over a stone and a few herbs fall off from his satchel - which the chulengo eats up. This triggers an idea from Katie and the team uses Peyo’s herb to get it to follow PlatypusOne up the mountain to find its family. On the mountains peak, they find other Guanacos grazing and they reunite the chulengo with its group. Back at the Treehouse, a picture of the guanaco herd is hung, marking another successful mission. In the garden, Hero befriends the duckling, but it rejoins its mother.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple isnt paying attention when Strawberry describes their campout tradition of telling "Tall Tales." So Apple tells her thrilling adventure of a wild road rally she entered, only to surprise the girls by proving the story is actually true.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Although usually in a great mood and always one to enjoy a good joke, Martis looks very sad: the small wooden box given to him by his grandfather has been damaged by water. Scoutbadger is sorry to see his friend in such a state. Along with Rosie and Woodsy, he decides to do his best to put a smile back on his face. But nothing seems to comfort Martis. Neither jokesnor surprises seem to dissipate his sadness.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks. When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon receives a football for his name day. He excitedly starts playing with it, but as he doesnt know the rules, hes a little clumsy. Fortunately, Ben comes by on his scooter and starts teaching Boribon. Practice pays off and Boribon scores his first goal.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has never left his residence and dreams of traveling the world. On the other hand, the world Julia knows the least is the Mouse Mansion. What if they played at traveling together staying there?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets had planned to go to the circus today, but Mom is too sick and Grandpa too busy to take them. So here they are, stuck at home. But it does not matter! With a bicycle, balloons and lots of imagination, they can recreate a circus in moms room. Mom has to call for help and Grandpa will prove to be a wonderful acrobat!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets have each lost a sock and are wondering where they could have disappeared to. Maybe they are in the "Land of lost socks", suggests Poet. The kids start to imagine poor little lonely socks which have lost their twin sisters. So they decide to help them get back together again, but many are still missing. Could it be Totos fault or the washing machines? Hard to say but the Triplets have a solution: wearing unmatching socks!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Sub-zero temperatures are causing problems for the chuggers. The docks are covered by thick fog and the haulers can’t get out with their deliveries on the treacherous tracks. It also means that no cargo ships will be able to dock today. Jackman has the Chug Patrollers out early gritting the tracks. When the Working Wheels Yard runs out of diesel, Vee declares an emergency and all diesel engines are grounded. The only place that still has a supply of diesel is the docks.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman and Hannah are organizing a pool party for Peter, but Mike drops some decorations onto a lantern, and soon the rescue team needs to be called.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The bream has gone missing from the fish counter at the Wholefish Cafe, and Detective James is determined to crack The Case of the Missing Fish.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Kate can’t jump high enough to retrieve a ball stuck in a tree, she wonders what it would be like to have superpowers. In Mimiloo, Tack’s new Supercharger invention gives everyone superpowers! But their new abilities aren’t enough to get Boomer out of a bouncy predicament.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate can’t get the timing right to jump rope. In Mimiloo, Gobble has a case of the sneezy snorts and needs boom chicka bee honey tea to feel better. In order to get the honey, Kate must lead her friends to find the beat and make the most beautiful music the bees have ever heard.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou feels frustrated when Rosie solves all the scavenger hunt clues at Grandma and Grandpa’s beach house. In fantasy, Caillou pretends to be a pirate captain on a sinking ship who learns the importance of listening to his team.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou doesn’t like Daddy’s chicken dinner, and he says so with a “Yuck!” Going into fantasy, Caillou pretends to be the Silver Knight, cooking a meal for a very picky King (Daddy), and the experience teaches him to express his dislike for something in a more polite way.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Percy is late to collect some sheep for an agricultural fair and bumps the wagon in his rush to be coupled up, backing into other trucks behind him. Percy is in such a hurry to collect the sheep that he doesn’t realise that there is a hole now at the back of the wagon. One by one the sheep escape without Percy realising. Thomas passes Percy and discovers the sheep and is forced to top and collect them. But the only place for the sheep to ride is in Annie or Clarabel!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across an eastern spotted skunk while playing a game of mini-golf in the garden. The Junior Rangers pop by the prairie to find a suitable home for the skunk, but an unfriendly coyote could put a dent in their plans.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo’s paper plane crashes into a young Malayan colugo. The Junior Rangers search the rainforest for the colugo’s mother, but the mission comes to a halt when they chance upon a forest fire. Will the Junior Rangers eventually succeed in their mission? Or will their plans go up in smoke?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an oriental pied hornbill while picking apples in his garden. To find the hornbill’s nest, the Junior Rangers set out for the rainforest once again.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The kids have bought Bill a remote-controlled car for his birthday.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat needs to deliver a piano for Lizzys first ever concert, but the van breaks down.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: On a very windy day in Big City, Oswald and Weenie volunteer to look after baby Catrina while Madame Butterfly goes back to the Diner for her blanket. Oswald buys a balloon as a present for Catrina but a strong wind carries Catrina and the balloon off high into the sky! Oswald and Weenie commandeer a hot air balloon to try and catch Catrina who flies further and further away from Big City until they all eventually reach outer space! Oswald and Weenie finally rescue Catrina and manage to hitch a ride back to big City on a shooting star.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry is taking a special picture of the gang in front of Big City’s geyser. While waiting around for their picture to be taken they decide to play a ball game but Weenie gets all covered in mud! Oswald tries to give Weenie a bath, but she doesn’t want to take one. After chasing her around Big City and getting himself and his friend all wet in the process, Oswald finally manages to get Weenie clean again and everyone has their picture taken.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class is having a picnic and everyone is happy. Especially Paxton! Learn about healthy snacks with Otus, Stripey and Yabba.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Zims weather balloons have gone missing. Mayor Okis weather forecasts are completely wrong! Messy, Zoom and Zim must fly through the skies to track them down.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Farmer Fuddles chickens have escaped. Their feathers make Vivienne Volcano very itchy. Messy has to find a way to scratch her itches and round up the chickens!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: At the girls campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the "Berry Deep Dark Forest." She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sours over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sours story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that none of his wishes come true in the real world, the dinosaurs take him to visit the wishing well.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry, Charlie, and the dinosaurs are playing at being pirates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Junior Ranger Zari is on a forest patrol in the Malaysian Forest when she later discovers an adorable Asian baby elephant. She contacts her fellow Junior Rangers Leo and Katie to ask for some help. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie were filling up an inflatable pool with water. They were interrupted when Leo receives a call from Zari, asking help on the baby elephant. After learning more about Asian elephants through Katies tablet and realize that the baby elephant must have been separated from its herd, they set off on a mission to reunite the baby elephant with its mother. When the Junior Ranger arrives, they see that baby elephant was cheerful beside Zari. Katie pulls up her tablet to see the closest river when they can go to meet the mother. After a while, the baby elephant sees a mud puddle and happily runs and lies in it. Then Ranger Rocky appears as he was nearby, introducing himself. The baby elephant sees Ranger Rocky and playfully cuddle from the baby elephant as it approaches him. Unable to free Ranger Rocky from the elephants weight, they come up with a clever plan using a branch as a snack to lure the baby elephant away.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Harvey and the new engine Samson are putting the dinosaur models in place for the Earl’s new Dinosaur Park. One of the dinosaurs swings towards Millie and gives her a fright. Samson and Harvey laugh, but Millie gets her own back by asking the groundsman to set his bonfire behind the model of the volcano and making them both think it’s erupting!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas causes a small accident by being silly he is so embarrassed that he blames it on someone else… called Geoffrey, an engine he just made up on the spur of the moment. But Thomas’ imaginary engine raises a lot of questions from his friends and soon Thomas is describing what Geoffrey looks like too. When the Fat Controller wants to meet this new engine Thomas realises that his story may have got a little out of hand!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu is entrusted with what seems to be an easy mission. It consists in moving a beehive in a field of honey flowers. But things get complicated when an accident occurs, and the beehive gets lost. Moreover, Grisu has to deal with Fume who has a sore throat and cannot spit fire. Grisu will finally succeed in getting the bee queen (and the other bees) into the beehive thanks to Miss Gertruds perfume. And Fume will be cured thanks to the honey!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza is on the ice cap conducting a polar bear study. She still has one last bear to tag but its too fast. So she needs a snowmobile pilot to help her approach and tag the beast. Its a perfect mission for Grisu who is no snowmobile pilot, but can adapt to anything and is impervious to cold! As he lands on the polar cap, Grisu unwittingly wakes up the napping bear and is chased after by it. He gets out of his bind thanks to Natureza. As theyre getting ready to tag the bear, Grisu, unwittingly again, burns the snowmobile engine. The mission seems compromised, but a firefighter never gives up! Resourceful Grisu uses his wind-filled parachute to pull the snowmobile and thanks to him, Natureza ends up tagging the bear.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a Midsummers night, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends decide to try to stay up all night. With the beautiful long dusk there is plenty of time for play, but one by one they drop off to sleep in the wee small hours. Luckily that leaves them plenty of energy to play the next day.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie and her brothers have just finished a nice snack and rush to leave the table to play outside. As they are about to leave, Margaret and Edmund remind them that they have to clean up and clear the table before they leave the burrow. Our trio pretends to agree, but once their parents are off, Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger decide to put off this boring chore until later and to go have fun…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are preparing to dig the foundations for a skyscraper in Spring City’s new business zone and are under pressure from Mayor Madison to get started. She keeps interrupting their work on Bob’s smart-phone. Scoop and Muck set a challenge to see which of them can dig/clear the earth quickest. Interrupted again, Bob calls a halt but the machines get carried away and keep digging. Scoop goes too deep and hits into something hard underground. Bob calls Anish Bose, the archaeologist, who announces the discovery of Roman ruins. The build will have to halt while they excavate the site. Scoop is filled with remorse and horrified to learn that Romans didn’t have machines like him. An interested crowd starts to gather as Anish discovers more artefacts. Mr Bentley arrives for a progress report but rather than being angry at the lack of progress he is excited by the historic discovery.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Christmas time. Bob and the team are building the Spring City Christmas display in the city centre’s plaza. Lofty loves everything Christmas and decorates the yard in snowflakes. Then he sees that Bob’s home doesn’t have any decorations, so he decides to give him the perfect present. Lofty arrives on site, determined to give Bob his Christmas present but when asked to help hang the lights, he puts the present down by the giant display tree. Lofty finishes his work and again tries to give Bob his present but now it’s lost somewhere in the display.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: At the base of the Andes Mountain, Peyo concocts a berry dip while Pico brings berries to him. Hearing a distressed animal, he finds an animal trapped inside a cave with its entrance blocked by a fallen tree. In the Garden, a duckling follows Hero around which Hero reacts by hiding behind Leo. They receive a call from Peyo and identify the animal as a Guanaco through the computer. With PlatypusOne, they reach the mountain, use a winch to free the Guanaco, discovering its a chulengo - a young guanaco. The chulengo follows Peyo closely, much to Peyo’s confusion. They decide that the chulengo should be with its family but they’re unsure how to transport it as it is afraid of PlatypusOne. Dumbfounded, they stumble upon Ranger Rocky who seeks Ranger Joeys advice. Ranger Joey explains Guanaco social structures and adaptations. The chulengo nudges Peyo which causes him to trip over a stone and a few herbs fall off from his satchel - which the chulengo eats up. This triggers an idea from Katie and the team uses Peyo’s herb to get it to follow PlatypusOne up the mountain to find its family. On the mountains peak, they find other Guanacos grazing and they reunite the chulengo with its group. Back at the Treehouse, a picture of the guanaco herd is hung, marking another successful mission. In the garden, Hero befriends the duckling, but it rejoins its mother.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah faces a perilous climb up the Caucasus Mountain, encountering an agitated East Caucasian Tur that leaves her stranded on a ledge. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo is attempting to break his own time record of climbing a tree but a call from Farah interrupts him. Farah fills them in on her dangerous situation so Leo, Katie, and Hero rush to her aid. Upon arrival, they rescue Farah but discover a distressed baby tur on another lower ledge on that same mountain. They try to get close to it but the protective mother tur charges to them, endangering herself at the edge of the mountaintop. They meet Ranger Rocky who calls up Ranger Joey to know more about the tur. With insights from Ranger Joey, they devise a plan using bilberry branches to lure the mother tur away, enabling Leo to safely rescue the stranded baby. The heartwarming reunion of turs at the mountains summit marks the success of their mission, celebrated with a photo in the treehouse. In the garden Hero, attempting to climb a tree branch, comically finds himself stuck and Leo slides down to save him.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: While trying to help Grandpa pick his tomatoes, Simon accidentally tears out an entire tomato plant! Grandpa laughs and calls Simon, the "King of the Goofs"! Simon is bummed though, and he is intent on proving to Grandpa that it’s not true, he’s no goof! Why he’s even going to hold onto Elvis’s leash later that day at the beach, you just wait and see! And even if the mischievous little dog thinks he can do whatever he wants, it’s Simon who will have the last word!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.desc: On a hot summer day, Berry, Dolly, Bubble and Balthazar put on their swimsuits, looked for their buckets, shovels and started to build the loveliest sand castle on the Sand Island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It’s December, and it’s gingerbread time! Berry and Dolly love making them. Berry’s house filled with the wonderful smell of the biscuits what the magpie immediately noticed from above. Grabbed the bowl and flew away with it. Oh my!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly are planting sunflowers on a spring day. They take care of the flowers carefully as they emerge from the ground and grow tall. The two friends are very happy. Unfortunately the joy does not last long; someone damaged the flowers.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Frogs are staying at the Guesthouse Appleseed to collect leaves. When Tilda discovers a beautiful portrait of herself, she asks Rupert, who also received a portrait, and they search for the artist.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: The big neighbourhood race is coming up, and Snaily, who came in last place last year, dreams of winning this time. He discovers his talent on Billys skateboard, but the rules stand in his way.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is excited about the cake contest, but when she burns her hands, she can’t bake anymore. Her friends at the Guesthouse Appleseed decide to help her by creating a special cake together.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are super impatient to go pick up the newspaper in the village with Grandpa. That’s because they are going to be able to sit in the motorcycle side-car. Awwwwesome! And especially because they are also going to be able to buy candy. What could be cooler?! Unfortunately, the side-car stalls on their way into town. What are they going to do? Well, to begin with, they are going to call the mechanic. No, but what are they going to do about the candy??!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A fun game of table tennis leads to the surprise discovery of a baby sea turtle and some sea turtle eggs! Can the Junior Rangers return the baby sea turtle and eggs to the beach while keeping them safe from hungry raccoons?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a greater mouse-deer back to its home in the rainforest. But can the Junior Rangers rescue the mouse-deer when it gets caught in an animal trap?
